name: Whole Red lentil and Mung bean Daal stew with shallots and tomatoes.(Sabut Masoor aur Mung)
description: This comforting mung bean daal soup is full of goodness and flavor
recipeIngredient: 3 cups of water (less for thicker stew)

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the lentils and beans for atleast 2 hours to overnight. Drain the water and keep ready.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the lentils and beans for atleast 2 hours to overnight. Drain the water and keep ready.

recipeInstructions.text: In a pressure cooker, add the oil and heat at medium.
recipeInstructions.name: In a pressure cooker, add the oil and heat at medium.

recipeInstructions.text: When the oil is hot, add mustard and cumin/fennel seeds and cover(the seeds will sputter out of the cooker).
recipeInstructions.name: When the oil is hot, add mustard and cumin/fennel seeds and cover(the seeds will sputter out of the cooker).

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the curry leaves, asafetida(hing), coriander powder and green chili. Mix for a few seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the curry leaves, asafetida(hing), coriander powder and green chili. Mix for a few seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the ginger, garlic and shallots and cook for 2 minutes until shallots turn golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the ginger, garlic and shallots and cook for 2 minutes until shallots turn golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the chopped tomato and turmeric powder and mix well. Cook for 3-4 minutes until tomato is mushy. This is the Tadka.
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the chopped tomato and turmeric powder and mix well. Cook for 3-4 minutes until tomato is mushy. This is the Tadka.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the drained and washed lentils+beans, water and salt and pressure cook on medium heat for 3-4 whistles. (20 minutes at with the pressure regulator at high pressure)
recipeInstructions.name: Add the drained and washed lentils+beans, water and salt and pressure cook on medium heat for 3-4 whistles. (20 minutes at with the pressure regulator at high pressure)

recipeInstructions.text: Let the pressure release by itself before opening. Serve hot topped with fresh cilantro.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the pressure release by itself before opening. Serve hot topped with fresh cilantro.

recipeInstructions.text: To refresh the daal, add a fresh tadka/tempering. heat oil, add mustard and cumin seeds and some red pepper flakes and pour over the daal.
recipeInstructions.name: To refresh the daal, add a fresh tadka/tempering. heat oil, add mustard and cumin seeds and some red pepper flakes and pour over the daal.

recipeInstructions.text: You can also pressure cook or slow cook the lentils till done and keep, and then add the tempering/tadka to it before serving, simmer for 10 minutes and serve.
recipeInstructions.name: You can also pressure cook or slow cook the lentils till done and keep, and then add the tempering/tadka to it before serving, simmer for 10 minutes and serve.

recipeInstructions.text: To cook in a pan, use a deep pan with a lid and cook covered on medium heat for 15 minutes then low heat for 30 minutes or more until both the beans are tender.
recipeInstructions.name: To cook in a pan, use a deep pan with a lid and cook covered on medium heat for 15 minutes then low heat for 30 minutes or more until both the beans are tender.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot with Indian flat breads like Roti, Paratha , Naan, or with Rice or pilafs.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot with Indian flat breads like Roti, Paratha , Naan, or with Rice or pilafs.

keywords: comfort food, Indian recipe, red lentils
